placard.para: Placard Standby Attitude Indicator located on panel P1 "ILS INDICATION INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Perform the following to verify the C ILS Receiver is operative for dispatch.

numlitem.para: Select any ILS frequency other than an active frequency for the current airport.
Select ILS on Captain or First Officer’s EFIS control panel.
Select ALTN EFI on Captain or First Officer’s instrument source select panel. Must be same side as selected in step 2.
Verify "LOC" and "GS" fail flags are not displayed on EHSI selected to ALTN.

Press and then release ILS test switch on ILS frequency select panel. Note: If ILS test switch on panel is inoperative, use test switch on C ILS Receiver. Verify the following on the EFI selected to ALTN:
The "LOC" and "GS" fail flags are momentarily in view, then go out of view.
"LOC" needle moves one dot left, "G/S" needle moves one dot up.
"LOC" needle moves one dot right, "G/S" needle moves one dot down.
Both needles go out of view.
Return ILS frequency selector to the parked "----" position.
Return EFI instrument source select to NORMAL.
Return EFIS control panel switch to MAP.
